bibl.title: A Possible Subject for Aeschylus' "Dike Play".
bibl.note: P. Oxy. XX, 2256 (= Pack2 46), fr. 9a and 9b = fr. 530-531 Mette; fr. 8 = fr. 535 Mette. Heracles is the most plausible pais margos yet suggested; the "Dike" fragments belong to the satyr play Kerykes.
bibl.seg: Sutton Dana Ferrin, A Possible Subject for Aeschylus' "Dike Play".

P. Oxy. XX, 2256 (= Pack2 46), fr. 9a and 9b = fr. 530-531 Mette; fr. 8 = fr. 535 Mette. Heracles is the most plausible pais margos yet suggested; the "Dike" fragments belong to the satyr play Kerykes.
